qas.question: Who did Kerry criticize during the 2004 campaign?
Why did Kerry criticize Bush during the 2004 campaign?
What had Kerry voted against after supporting the initial Iraq authorization?

answers.text: an $87 billion supplemental appropriations bill to pay for the subsequent war

qas.question: What did Bush's campaign call Kerry for changing his mind about Iraq?

context: During his bid to be elected president in 2004, Kerry frequently criticized <a0_0>President George W. Bush<a0_0/> <a1_0>for the Iraq War<a1_0/>. While Kerry had initially voted in support of authorizing President Bush to use force in dealing with Saddam Hussein, he voted against <a2_0>an $87 billion supplemental appropriations bill to pay for the subsequent war<a2_0/>. His statement on March 16, 2004, "I actually did vote for the $87 billion before I voted against it," helped the Bush campaign to paint him as <a3_0>a flip-flopper<a3_0/> and has been cited as contributing to Kerry's defeat.
